sections: A little more than a decade after the financial crisis and Wall Street bailout, huge banks made big money off the people hit hardest by the pandemic and the economic crisis, according to little-noticed disclosures to bank regulators.
• How Republican legislators are passing laws letting people use their cars to run over peaceful protestors.
• How some Democratic states say they are taking the climate crisis seriously, and yet still approving fossil fuel projects.
• Why progressives should focus on running candidates for governor in states across the country.
• How one particular part of the pandemic experience may be changing our brains in ways we haven’t noticed.
